entities.description: "Collobert et al. proposed the first word-level neural network model for NER in 2011, using a convolution layer and CRF layer for predictions."
"Huang et al. presented a word LSTM model in 2015, demonstrating improved performance with the addition of a CRF layer."
"Chalapathy et al. applied similar systems to the DrugNER domain in 2016, achieving a high F1 score on MedLine test data."
"Xu et al. applied the architecture to medical NER in 2017, achieving a significant F1 score on a disease NER corpus."
"Plank et al. implemented the same model for multilingual POS tagging in 2016."
"Yan et al. implemented word level feed forward NN, bi-LSTM, and window bi-LSTM for NER across multiple languages in 2016, highlighting performance improvements with added features."
"Kim et al. first highlighted the potential of character NER neural models in 2016, using highway networks over CNN on character sequences."
"Pham and Le-Hong implemented the character model for Vietnamese NER in 2017, achieving a notable F-score on Vietnamese test data."
"Dong et al. used character models in Chinese, achieving near state of the art performance."
"Kuru et al. proposed CharNER 11, implementing the character RNN model for NER on 7 different languages, achieving various F-scores on different CoNLL datasets."
"Ling et al. proposed word representation using RNN (Bi-LSTM) over characters of the word, achieving state of the art results on POS task in multiple languages."

"Gillick et al. implemented a sequence to sequence model (Byte to Span- BTS) using encoder decoder architecture over sequence of characters, achieving high performance on CoNLL 2002 and 2003 dataset."
"Ma and Hovy implemented a model combining word context and characters of a word for NER, achieving high F1 scores on CoNLL 2003 English dataset and WSJ portion of PTB."
"Chiu and Nichols achieved high F1 scores on CoNLL 2003 English dataset and Onto notes 5.0 dataset by adding lexicons and capitalization features to the model."
"DrugNER is a domain-specific NER task focused on extracting drug-related entities, with Chalapathy et al. achieving an F1 score on MedLine test data."
"MedLine test data is a dataset used for evaluating the performance of NER models in the medical domain, specifically for the DrugNER task."
"Disease NER corpus is a dataset used by Xu et al. for evaluating their medical NER model, achieving an F1 score."
"English PTB is a dataset used for evaluating POS tagging models, with Ling et al. achieving high accuracy using their word representation method."
"WSJ portion of PTB is a part of the Penn Treebank dataset used for POS-tagging tasks, with Ma and Hovy achieving high POS-tagging accuracy."
"OntoNotes 5.0 dataset is used for evaluating NER models, with Chiu and Nichols achieving an F score on this dataset."
"CoNLL 2002 dataset is a benchmark dataset used for evaluating NER models, with BTS achieving high F-scores."
"Vietnamese test data is a dataset used for evaluating NER models in the Vietnamese language, with Pham and Le-Hong achieving an F-score."
"Spanish CoNLL dataset is a benchmark dataset used for evaluating NER models, with Kuru et al. and BTS achieving different F-scores."
"Dutch CoNLL dataset is a benchmark dataset used for evaluating NER models, with Kuru et al. and BTS achieving different F-scores."

"Chiu and Nichols achieved high F1 and F scores on CoNLL 2003 English and Onto notes 5.0 datasets by adding lexicons and capitalization features to their model."
"The CoNLL 2003 English dataset is a benchmark used for evaluating the performance of named entity recognition models."
"The Onto notes 5.0 dataset is another benchmark used for evaluating the performance of named entity recognition models."
"Misawa et al. showed that their neural architecture outperformed others on the organization entity class for Japanese NER."
"Limsopatham and Collier implemented a character+word level NER model for Twitter NER and achieved specific F scores on segmentation and categorization."
"Twitter NER is an event or task focused on named entity recognition within tweets."
"Santos and Guimaraes implemented a model that achieved high F scores on Spanish CoNLL 2002 data and Portuguese NER data."
"The Spanish CoNLL 2002 data is a dataset used for evaluating named entity recognition models in the Spanish language."
"The Portuguese NER data is a dataset used for evaluating named entity recognition models in the Portuguese language."
Lample et al. introduced a model architecture that achieved high F scores on multiple language NER datasets from CoNLL 2002 and 2003.
"Dernoncourt et al. implemented a model in the NeuroNER toolkit with the goal of providing easy usability and real-time performance visualization."
"NeuroNER is a toolkit for named entity recognition models, integrated with the BRAT annotation tool for ease of development."
"The BRAT annotation tool is integrated with NeuroNER to facilitate the development of neural network NER models in new domains."
"Habibi et al. implemented a model for various biomedical NER tasks and achieved higher performance than most other participants."
"Bharadwaj et al. utilized phonemes from Epitran for NER in addition to characters and words, achieving state-of-the-art performance on the Spanish CoNLL 2002 dataset."

"Yang et al. proposed a multi-task and multi-lingual joint learning system and later introduced transfer learning for multi-task and multi-learning, showing improvements on CoNLL 2002 and 2003 NER data."
"Yadav et al. implemented a model that augments the character+word NN architecture with affixes, a feature from feature-engineering approaches."
"Epitran is a tool used for extracting phonemes, utilized by Bharadwaj et al. in their NER model."
"GRU is a type of RNN cell used by Yang et al. for word representation in their multi-task and multi-lingual joint learning system."
"CRF refers to Conditional Random Fields, a model used in various NER systems for predicting entity labels."
"LSTM-B stands for Long Short-Term Memory model with a backward look, used in NER architectures."
"LSTM-F stands for Long Short-Term Memory model with a forward look, used in NER architectures."
"NER stands for Named Entity Recognition, the event or task of identifying named entities in text."
"CHEMDNER data is a dataset used for evaluating NER models in the biomedical domain."
"Krallinger et al. are associated with the CHEMDNER data, a dataset for biomedical NER tasks."
"Saha et al. are mentioned in relation to the use of affix features in biomedical NER."
"Tjong Kim Sang is associated with early NER systems and the use of affix features."
"Cucerzan and Yarowsky are associated with early NER systems and the use of affix features."
"De Meulder is associated with Tjong Kim Sang in the context of early NER systems and affix features."
"Santos and Cardoso are associated with the Portuguese NER data used for evaluating NER models."
"Baldwin et al. are associated with Twitter NER, which Limsopatham and Collier worked on improving."
"The English CoNLL 2003 data is a dataset used for evaluating NER models, with NeuroNER achieving a high F score."

relationships.description: "Chiu and Nichols evaluated their model on the CoNLL 2003 English dataset."

entities.description: "The IJCNLP-08 Workshop is an event focused on Named Entity Recognition for South and South East Asian Languages."
"The Asian Federation of Natural Language Processing is an organization that hosts events and workshops, including the IJCNLP-08 Workshop."
"Hyderabad is a city in India where the IJCNLP-08 Workshop took place."
